    • Election 2025
Elections

Elections Information Election Day will take place on Saturday, May 2, 2026. Waller County will be conducting the elections. The City of Brookshire, City Secretary's office will be available by phone and email if you have any questions. For direct assistance, contact the City Secretary's Office.

  • City Secretary, LaKethia Connor
  • (281) 375-5050
  • Email lconnor@brookshiretx.gov

The City of Brookshire is a General Law Type "A" city and has five Council members that serve at Large for the City and one Mayor. Terms are for two years.

Qualified electors will be electing 3 offices, 3 City Council at large, Position 3, Position 4, and Position 5 for the City of Brookshire in May of 2026.

  • Candidate Packets for the May 2026 General Election are available to be picked up at the City Secretary's office Monday - Thursday 8:30 am to 5:00 pm and Friday 8:30 am to 4:30 pm. The offices of the City Council will appear on this Ballot.
  • Filings will be accepted during normal business hours (Monday - Thursday 8:30 am to 5:00 pm and Friday 8:30 am to 4:30 pm) There is no fee to file.
  • Registered voters within the City of Brookshire can vote during Early Voting or on Election Day.
  • The City Secretary's Office is responsible for overseeing municipal elections, including serving as the contract administrator for election services through Waller County.
  • The City Secretary's Office will be receiving all required candidate filings (including campaign finance reports) and conducting a drawing for the order in which names will appear on the ballot.
  • Early Voting will be from Monday, April 20, 2026, to Tuesday, April 28, 2026.
  • General Elections are held on the first Saturday of May.
  • May 2, 2026 - Election Day Polling Locations (when available)
Internet Posting Requirement Notice of Deadline to File Candidate Application and Packet for 2026 Election
